messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fake blood??? anyone??
messages.msgSnippet: ... This from my sister, who has spent the last month working at the Spirit store and just spent the weekend doing Boo at the Zoo: Mix Karo syrup, chocolate
messages.messageBody:
On Tue, 30 Oct 2001 11:23:42 -0500 "KimBaker" <azhom@...> writes:
> hi all, does anyone know how to make some pretty "good" fake blood.
> my son,
> just informed me he needs some for his costume tomorrow. help

This from my sister, who has spent the last month working at the Spirit
store and just spent the weekend doing Boo at the Zoo:

"Mix Karo syrup, chocolate syrup, and red food coloring. We added coconut
rum, but I'm not sure you really need that. It did thin it out a little,
though."

Daron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fake blood??? anyone??
messages.msgSnippet: From _Icky Sticky Foamy Slimy Ooey Gooey Chemistry_ Light corn syrup baking soda red food coloring four parts syrup    (they were using a test tube, so
messages.messageBody:
From _Icky Sticky Foamy Slimy Ooey Gooey Chemistry_

Light corn syrup
baking soda
red food coloring

four parts syrup (they were using a test tube, so teaspoons?)
two parts baking soda
ten drops of red food coloring (or more, if you're making a greater quantity)

Add just a little warm water and stir until it's dark red and sticky but
runny.

BUT the main purpose of this one was to then pur vinegar on the "wound" you
paint and watch it start to bubble and foam.

It says you might not want to leave it on too long because the red food
coloring will stain after a while.

If that's not a good one (you could experiment today and see if it's too
sticky, maybe), I bet if you go to google.com and enter fake blood recipe
there will be five or a dozen.

Sandra

Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd
